posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: Hello, I’m a new programmer in FRC , and I created my first swerve (maxSwerve) code with YAGSL example. I have some troubles with rotating. I checked encoders with REV Hardware Client physically, and with Advantage Scope, i was configuring it 9 times, and still nothing. What can it be? Here is my code GitHub - chereshenka0/YAGSL-Example-Swerve video recorded from back of the robot

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
chereshenka:

I have some troubles with rotating.

You’ll get the best help by providing as much detail as you can. ‘Troubles’ could be a myriad of things, all with different solutions.

Providing 1) the symptoms you’re seeing 2) the conditions that you’re seeing them in, and 3) things you’ve tried so far

will all be useful in debugging the issue further. And as always, a picture (or in this case, a video) is worth a thousand words
Can you send a link to your code, a video of your problem with the Elastic swerve widget, and your exact problem?

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked:
GitHub - chereshenka0/YAGSL-Example-Swerve Contribute to chereshenka0/YAGSL-Example-Swerve development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to chereshenka0/YAGSL-Example-Swerve development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: I see when i move forward, wheels are going diagonal. I tried to power cycle robot, change AbsoluteEncoderOffset, configure it, physically check if encoders work, checked wiring
You mean like this?

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: yes

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Right under the picture is the answer if you didn’t get it. “ This happens when you input module locations incorrectly due to where the gyroscope is oriented on the robot or you have the device configurations in the wrong module locations in the configuration files. **If this happens to you, you HAVE misconfigured your modules.”

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: My modules’ location is correct

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked:
Okay… let’s do this. WITHOUT looking at code or id labels go into whichever client you are using and tell me your ids. Follow this: FR- drive, angle, abs encoder BR- 1, 2, 3

Edited I forgot to include encoder.

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Okay, lets go ahead and start from the beginning. Firstly, are you using an old config from 2024? If so delete it and do not look at it again. Redo your entire config using the config generator . Secondly, what is your full setup: module and level, motors, motor controllers, encoders, and IMU. Thirdly, after you have the new config send me a video of the elastic swerve widget. There is a guide on how to get the widget in the docs. Finally, did you actually go to the robot for those IDs or did you look at the code. Every honest answer gets you closer to a working robot.

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: I am using config form for 2025. Setup: attached encoder, drive - sparkmax neo , angle - sparkmax neo550, maxSwerve modules, imu - pigeon2. I went to the robot for ids. Also code with new config files doesn’t want to deploy to the robot.

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: I will be able to help as soon as you send EVERYTHING I listed. Until then I will not reply.

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Also if there’s an error I need to see it. “It doesn’t work” is not adequate information to debug something.

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: So, when i put numbers except 0 or 360 to the absoluteencoderoffset, wheels  start just spinning around crazy Also i cant attach a video, because chief delphi doesnt allow me to do that

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Last response if I don’t get everything listed at once. As for the video use Imgur or something to link it instead.

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: A picture may be worth a thousand words but a decent video is worth a million. I can debug a whole lot more with a video. You can say the wheel just spins but there’s at least 10 different ways that wheel can spin which all point to different issues pretty distinctively.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
Here is a good place to start if you haven’t found these yet.

A video really does help, so I would focus on that and linking it (sharable link on google drive maybe?) , generally the issues boil down to the same half a dozen things (e.g. motor inversion, CAN IDs and corners, magnets not glued, software versions…)

I know it can be frustrating trying to debug, especially when others want to help and patience runs thin. We are here to help, work with us and hopefully nobody holds an ultimatum over your head. More information that is objective fact the better. There are quite a few of us that can help get you back on track.

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked:
Access Google Drive with a Google account (for personal use) or Google Workspace account (for business use).

In this link should be all stuff that you need(videos from actual robot, simulation, Advantage Scope, photos of modules config) drive motor - sparkmax neo , angle motor - sparkmax neo550, maxSwerve modules, imu - pigeon2. All IDs are correct, i double checked it with code and physically too. FR - 11 , 21 , 0 BR - 13 , 23 , 0 FL - 10 , 20 , 0 BL - 12 , 22 , 0
